Description: Top half of a mould-made pottery lamp; the side handle and most of the nozzle are missing. The discus edge is decorated with a narrow chevron or wreath pattern within two moulded rings. The slightly concave discus is decorated with and impressed six-petalled rosette, in the centre of which is a filling-hole, and there are six subsidiary holes pierced between the petals.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q573)
